anvil.api

Interface PlugIn


  • public interface PlugIn
    Represents an interface for a PlugIn.

    PlugIns are .jar files that Users can create with the API and add-on to Anvil. Each class implementing the PlugIn interface should get its own separate .jar file, as to not confuse the interpreter, and to keep consistency. A class that implements this interface is literally the entry point for the PlugIn.

    All PlugIns should be mutually exclusive of every other, that meaning that no PlugIn should rely on another to perform an action before or after this one.

    When implementing the PlugIn interface, it's very important to not make the class abstract, other-wise Anvil can't properly load the PlugIn, and it will be ignored.

    Every method is run on a separate thread. This means that even if a method is already running, another method could be invoked (including the same method that's already running). This means that all PlugIns should make their data thread safe.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Garrett Stonis

    • Method Detail

      • onLoad

        void onLoad()
        Runs once every time Anvil is started.

      • onShutDown

        void onShutDown()
        Runs once every time Anvil is shut down.

      • onThrowable

        void onThrowable(java.lang.Throwable e)
        If for whatever reason the PlugIn throws an unhandled throwable (Exception or Error) in any other PlugIn method, this method will be called. It will not be called if this method also throws an unhandeled throwable, so don't worry about those kinds of loops.

        Once this method is called on a separate thread, Anvil will no longer interact with the PlugIn until it [Anvil] is restarted.

        Any other currently running methods of this PlugIn will continue to run until they exit.

        Parameters:
        e - Throwable object containing the Throwable that was thrown by the PlugIn.

      • onServerStart

        void onServerStart(java.lang.String tag)
        Runs once every time the wrapped Minecraft server is started. This is executed when the server outputs the "Done!" output line.
        Parameters:
        tag - The Runner tag of the Runner that was started.
        See Also:
        Runner, Defaults.DONE_LOADING

      • onServerStop

        void onServerStop(java.lang.String tag)
        Runs once every time the wrapped Minecraft server is shut down. This is executed when the server's process dies.
        Parameters:
        tag - The Runner tag of the Runner that was stopped.
        See Also:
        Runner.stop(), Runner.stop(boolean), Runner.stopForcibly()

      • interpretServerOutputLine

        void interpretServerOutputLine(java.lang.String tag,
                               ServerOutputLine outputLine)
        Runs once every time Anvil receives an output-line from the server.

        Every output-line is interpreted by the wrapper first, then to the list of loaded PlugIns. Anvil will call each PlugIn's interpretServerOutputLine() method in an indiscriminate order, this means that no 2 PlugIns should try to interact with each other unless done so intelligently.

        Will interpret lines even if the Runner from the tag isn't completely started. It might be wise to check if the server is fully started before interpreting output lines. Use onServerStart(String) to do this.

        Parameters:
        tag - The tag of the Runner the output line came from.
        outputLine - The ServerOutputLine to interpret.
        See Also:
        Runner, ServerOutputLine
